name: material
title: Material
description: An entity that can be identified, exist for some period of time, and consist in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.
comments: The term is defined at the most general level to admit descriptions of any subtype of material entity within the scope of Darwin Core. In particular, any kind of material sample, preserved specimen, fossil, or exemplar from living collections is intended to be subsumed under this term.
examples: `the entire contents of a trawl`; `a subset of the contents of a trawl`; `the body of a fish`; `the stomach contents of a fish`; `a rock containing fossils`; `a fossil within a rock`; `an herbarium sheet with its attached plant specimen`; `a flower on a plant specimen`; `a pollen grain`; `a specific water sample`; `an isolated molecule of DNA`
rdfs:comment: An entity that can be identified, exists for some period of time, and consists in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.title: Material Entity ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a particular instance of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: digitalSpecimenID
fields.title: Digital Specimen ID
fields.description: An identifier for a Digital Specimen resource.
fields.comments: A Digital Specimen is defined in https://doi.org/10.3897/rio.7.e67379. A dwc:digitalSpecimenID is intended to uniquely and persistently identify a Digital Specimen. Recommended best practice is to use a DOI with machine readable metadata in the DOI record that uses a community agreed metadata profile (also known as FDO profile) for a Digital Specimen. For an example see: https://doi.org/10.3535/N75-CR4-0SM?noredirect. The identifier is for a digital information artifact (the Digital Specimen) as opposed to an identifier for a specific instance of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a particular instance of a Digital Specimen.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: materialCategory
fields.title: Material Category
fields.description: A broad category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a limited, tightly controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: discipline
fields.title: Discipline
fields.description: The primary branch or branches of knowledge represented by the dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: This term can be used to classify records according to branches of knowledge. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). It is also recommended to use this field to describe specimenType in MIDS.
fields.rdfs:comment: The primary branch or branches of knowledge represented by the record.

fields.name: materialEntityType
fields.title: Material Entity Type
fields.description: A narrow category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: A more generic classification of a dwc:MaterialEntity than dwc:preparations. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Macro-object`; `Micro-object`; `Oversized object`; `Cut/polished gemstone`; `Compound Specimen`; `Core`; `Mixed Materials`; `Environmental sample`; `Microscope slide`; `Spore print`; `Macrofossil`; `Mesofossil`; `Microfossil`; `Pinned object/specimen`; `Taxidermy mount`; `Blood sampling cards`; `Oversized fossil`; `Anthropogenic Artifact`
fields.rdfs:comment: A category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.title: Institution Code
fields.description: A name (or acronym) an organization.
fields.rdfs:comment: A name (or acronym) an organization.

fields.name: institutionID
fields.title: Institution ID
fields.description: An identifier for an organization.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the Global Registry of Scientific Collections (https://scientific-collections.gbif.org/).
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

fields.name: ownerInstitutionCode
fields.title: Owner Institution Code
fields.description: A name (or acronym) in use by an institution having ownership of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

fields.name: ownerInstitutionID
fields.title: Owner Institution ID
fields.description: An identifier for an institution that owns a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the Global Registry of Scientific Collections (https://scientific-collections.gbif.org/).

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.title: Collection Code
fields.description: A name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying a collection.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

fields.name: collectionID
fields.title: Collection ID
fields.description: An identifier for a collection.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Global Registry of Scientific Collections (https://scientific-collections.gbif.org/).
fields.rdfs:comment: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.title: Catalog Number
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for a dwc:MaterialEntity within a collection.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.title: Other Catalog Numbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same dwc:MaterialEntity, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same dwc:Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

fields.name: collectedBy
fields.title: Collected By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for collecting a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in dwc:collectorNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (dwc:recordNumber), should be listed first.

fields.name: collectedByID
fields.title: Collected By ID
fields.description: An identifier for the dcterms:Agent responsible for collecting a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: objectQuantity
fields.title: Object Quantity
fields.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of differentiable dwc:MaterialEntities comprising this dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: An dwc:objectQuantity must have a corresponding dwc:objectQuantityType.

fields.name: objectQuantityType
fields.title: Object Quantity Type
fields.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:MaterialEntities.
fields.comments: An dwc:objectQuantityType must have a corresponding dwc:objectQuantity.

fields.name: collectorNumber
fields.title: Collector Number
fields.description: An identifier given to a dwc:MaterialEntity at the time it was collected.
fields.comments: Often serves as a link between field notes and a dwc:MaterialEntity, such as a specimen collector's number.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier given to the dwc:Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and a dwc:Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

fields.name: preparations
fields.title: Preparations
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: disposition
fields.title: Disposition
fields.description: A current state of a dwc:MaterialEntity with respect to where it can be found.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The current state of a dwc:MaterialEntity with respect to a collection.

fields.name: verbatimLabel
fields.title: Verbatim Label
fields.description: A verbatim original representation of the written information affixed or related to a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters. Best practice is to add comment “verbatimLabel derived from human transcription” in dwc:materialEntityRemarks. Examples can be found at https://dwc.tdwg.org/examples/verbatimLabel.
fields.rdfs:comment: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters. Best practice is to add comment “verbatimLabel derived from human transcription” in dwc:occurrenceRemarks.

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.title: Associated Sequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibiographicResources for dwc:NucleotideSequences associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: materialReferences
fields.title: Material References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: informationWithheld
fields.title: Information Withheld
fields.description: Additional information that exists about a resource, but that is not shared publicly.
fields.examples: `location information not given for endangered species`; `collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples`
fields.rdfs:comment: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.title: Data Generalizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.examples: `Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

fields.name: materialEntityRemarks
fields.title: Material Entity Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.examples: `found in association with charred remains`; `some original fragments missing`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:MaterialEntity instance.

fields.name: evidenceForOccurrenceID
fields.title: Evidence For Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence for which a dwc:MaterialEntity provides evidence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: derivedFromMaterialEntityID
fields.title: Derived From Material Entity ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity from which this dwc:MaterialEntity was derived.
fields.comments: This dwc:MaterialEntity is separate from a dwc:MaterialEntity from which it was derived (cf. dwc:isPartOfMaterialEntityID). Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a particular instance of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: derivationEventID
fields.title: Derivation Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event during which a dwc:MaterialEntity was derived from another dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: derivationType
fields.title: Derivation Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of the derivation of one dwc:MaterialEntity from another dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Not expected to be used in Simple Darwin Core

fields.name: isPartOfMaterialEntityID
fields.title: Is Part Of Material Entity ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity of which this dwc:MaterialEntity is a part.
fields.comments: This dwc:MaterialEntity was not taken from a dwc:MaterialEntity of which it is a part. Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a particular instance of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.title: Verbatim Identification
fields.description: A string representing a taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.examples: `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser × Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`, `Potentilla × pantotricha Soják`; `Aconitum pilipes × A. variegatum; `Lepomis auritus x cyanellus`
fields.rdfs:comment: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.

fields.name: typeStatus
fields.title: Type Status
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

fields.name: typeDesignationType
fields.title: typeDesignationType
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a type designation.
fields.comments: From https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/typesandspecimen.xml.
fields.rdfs:comment: The reason why this specimen or name is designated as a type.

fields.name: typifiedName
fields.title: Typified Name
fields.description: A scientific name for which a specimen or other name is the type.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is also to indicate the dwc:typeStatus of the specimen.
fields.rdfs:comment: A scientific name that is based on a type specimen.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.title: Identified By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a dwc:Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the dwc:Survey. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.title: Identified By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)
fields.rdfs:comment: A person, group, or organization who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.title: Date Identified
fields.description: A date on which the subject was determined as representing a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 at or after 8:40am and before 8:41 UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (29 August 2018 at or after 3:19pm and before 3:20pm local time); `1809-02-12` (within the day 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (in the month of June 1906); `1971` (in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time within the interval beginning 1 March 2007 at 1pm UTC and before 11 May 2008 at 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time within the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and before the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between the beginning of 13 November 2007 and before 15 November 2007)
fields.rdfs:comment: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the dwc:Taxon.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.title: Identification References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources used in the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a dwc:Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the dwc:Survey. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.title: Identification Verification Status
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which a dwc:Identification has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.
fields.rdfs:comment: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.title: Identification Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uñas.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: In DwC-DP, the dwc:taxonID is always an external link to a taxon record. As such, if present, it should be a resolvable globally unique identifier. See the Identifiers section of https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/README.md.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of dwc:Taxon information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: scientificNameID
fields.title: Scientific Name ID
fields.description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: In DwC-DP, the dwc:scientificNameID is always an external link to a taxon record. As such, if present, it should be a resolvable globally unique identifier. See the Identifiers section of https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/README.md.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

fields.name: geoClassificationCode
fields.title: Geo Classification Code
fields.description: An identifier for a minext:classificationCode.
fields.comments: Classification codes are specific to a classification system and conform to a xkos:notationPattern.
fields.rdfs:comment: Alphanumeric pattern that adheres to a defined encoding scheme that identifies a particular term in a classification scheme.

fields.name: geoName
fields.title: Geo Name
fields.description: A human-readable lexical label assigned to a mineral includes both informal (e.g., variety, synonym) and formal (classification) forms.
fields.rdfs:comment: A human-readable lexical label assigned to a mineral includes both informal (e.g., variety, synonym) and formal (classification) forms.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A scientific name string, not including authorship, date or identification qualifiers.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet); `×Agropogon littoralis`; `Mentha ×smithiana`; `Agrostis stolonifera L. × Polypogon monspeliensis`
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the dwc:identificationQualifier term.

fields.name: scientificNameAuthorship
fields.title: Scientific Name Authorship
fields.description: The authorship information for a dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.
fields.rdfs:comment: The authorship information for the dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.

fields.name: vernacularName
fields.title: Vernacular Name
fields.description: A common or vernacular name.
fields.rdfs:comment: A common or vernacular name.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.title: Taxon Rank
fields.description: A taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. The taxon ranks of algae, fungi and plants are defined in the International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants (Schenzhen Code Articles H3.2, H4.4 and H.3.1).
fields.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: externalClassificationSource
fields.title: External Classification Source
fields.description: A reference to a source outside the dataset where the identifying name, code, or taxon concept can be found.
fields.comments: The external source applies to whichever of dwc:taxonID, dwc:scientificNameID, minext:geoClassificationCode, minext:geoName, dwc:scientificName, or dwc:vernacularName is populated.
fields.examples: `http://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/`; `https://avibase.bsc-eoc.org/`; `Dana, J. D., Dana, E. S., & Gaines, R. V. (1997). Dana's new mineralogy: The system of mineralogy of James Dwight Dana and Edward Salisbury Dana.`; `Strunz H, Nickel EH (2001) Strunz Mineralogical Tables, 9th Edition. Berlin and Stuttgart 870 pp.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to optionally include query strings that act to pre-populate web page form elements and communicate the context.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
